title: Yum Yum Sauce Recipe
description: Japanese steakhouse yum yum sauce made with mayo, paprika, tomato paste, sugar, and garlic is a creamy, tangy sauce perfect for dipping or drizzling.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Side Dish Sauces and Condiments Sauces Yum Yum Sauce 4.4 (152) 125 Reviews 15 Photos This Japanese steakhouse yum yum sauce, or white sauce, is a mayonnaise-based sauce that's creamy and delicious. Perfect for dipping or drizzling. Submitted by Maybole Updated on January 30, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 15 15 15 15 Prep Time: 5 mins Additional Time: 8 hrs Total Time: 8 hrs 5 mins Servings: 12 Yield: 1 1/2 cups Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 1 ¼ cups mayonnaise ¼ cup water 1 tablespoon melted butter 1 teaspoon tomato paste 1 teaspoon white sugar, or more to taste ½ teaspoon garlic powder ¼ teaspoon paprika 1 pinch cayenne pepper Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Whisk mayonnaise, water, butter, tomato paste, sugar, garlic powder, paprika, and cayenne together until smooth. Cover and refrigerate, 8 hours to overnight. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 376 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Yum Yum Sauce 01 of 15 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 15 Photo by  Amber McCulloch 07/04/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow 03 of 15 Photo by  Gabby 08/19/2021 it was good but alot of tweeking. 04 of 15 Photo by  Ahlaynah 08/06/2021 05 of 15 Photo by  WMPROS 05/22/2020 Great recipe!! I made this, and made these adjustments -increased the sugar to 4 tsp, added 1/4 c heavy cream and milk instead of water. The sugar takes the edge off the mayo tang. I did use Hellman’s real mayo Tastes much like what our local restaurant makes 06 of 15 Photo by  Marisa Villegas 05/16/2020 07 of 15 Photo by  Janelle Eddingsaas Smith 02/17/2020 We really loved this recipe. We doubled it and added an extra Tablespoons of sugar and tomato paste. So delicious. 08 of 15 Photo by  Melissa Cox-Fogleman 09/17/2019 09 of 15 Photo by  PIZZAMYHEART 04/09/2018 10 of 15 Photo by  Jackie Morrison-Seavolt 01/25/2017 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Nicole's Japanese Shrimp Sauce 7 Ratings Gyoza Sauce 158 Ratings Cilantro Serrano Cream Sauce 99 Ratings Dynamite Sauce 45 Ratings Nona's Japanese Ume Dressing 5 Ratings Quesadilla Sauce 16 Ratings Bacon Wrapped Brown Sugar Smokies Dipping Sauce 127 Ratings Bob's Teriyaki Sauce and Marinade 8 Ratings Tonkatsu Sauce 61 Ratings Teriyaki Sauce and Marinade 311 Ratings Fruity Sweet and Sour Sauce 71 Ratings Japanese Teriyaki Sauce 56 Ratings Eel Sauce 78 Ratings Tempura Dipping Sauce 22 Ratings Zaxby's Chicken Fingers Dipping Sauce 76 Ratings Tonkatsu Sauce Mimic Recipe 2 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
